Package camzup.core

Class Edge3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Edge3
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Edge3>
public class Edge3 extends Object implements Comparable<Edge3>
Organizes components of a 3D mesh into an edge with an origin and destination. This is not used by a mesh internally; it is created upon retrieval from a mesh.

  • Field Summary

    static int
    sharedCoord(Edge3 a, Edge3 b)
    Tests to see if two edges share a vertex coordinate: Returns -1 when a's origin is b's destination. Returns -2 when a's destination is b's destination Returns 1 when a's destination is b's origin. Returns 2 when a's origin is b's origin. Returns 0 when none of the above conditions are met. If the left and right comparisand are the same, returns 2.

    • Edge3

      public Edge3()
      The default constructor. Creates two empty vertices.

    • Edge3

      public Edge3(Vec3 coOrigin, Vec2 txOrig, Vec3 nmOrig, Vec3 coDest, Vec2 txDest, Vec3 nmDest)
      Constructs an edge from the origin and destination coordinate, texture coordinate and normal data. Creates two vertex objects.
      Parameters:
      coOrigin - origin coordinate
      txOrig - origin texture coordinate
      nmOrig - origin normal
      coDest - destination coordinate
      txDest - destination texture coordinate
      nmDest - destination normal

      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination

      public Edge3 rotateLocal(float cosa, float sina, Vec3 axis, Vec3 center)

    • scaleGlobal

      public Edge3 scaleGlobal(float scalar)
      Scales the coordinates of this edge. The texture coordinates are unaffected. Uses global coordinates, i.e., doesn't consider the face's position.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar
      Returns:
      this edge
      See Also:
      • Vec3.mul(Vec3, float, Vec3)

    • scaleLocal

      public Edge3 scaleLocal(float scalar, Vec3 center)
      Scales the coordinates of this edge. Subtracts the edge's mean center (midpoint) from each vertex, scales, then adds the mean center.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the uniform scalar
      center - the edge center
      Returns:
      this edge
      See Also:
      • Vec3.sub(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)
      • Vec3.mul(Vec3, float, Vec3)
      • Vec3.add(Vec3, Vec3, Vec3)

      Scales the coordinates of this edge. Subtracts the edge's mean center (midpoint) from each vertex, scales, then adds the mean center.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the nonuniform scalar
      center - the edge's center
      Returns:
      this edge

    • areNeighbors

      public static boolean areNeighbors(Edge3 a, Edge3 b)
      Evaluates whether two edges are complements or neighbors, i.e., whether one edge's origin is the other's destination.
      Parameters:
      a - left comparisand
      b - right comparisand
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      • Vert3.approxCoord(Vert3, Vert3)

    • azimuth

      public static float azimuth(Edge3 edge)
      Finds the azimuth of an edge. Subtracts the destination coordinate from that of the origin, then supplies the difference to atan2 .
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the heading
      See Also:
      • Utils.atan2(float, float)

    • dist

      public static float dist(Edge3 a, Vec3 b)
      Finds the distance between an edge and a point.
      Parameters:
      a - the edge
      b - the point
      Returns:
      the distance

    • eval

      public static Vec3 eval(Edge3 edge, float step, Vec3 target)
      Finds a point on the edge given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . Uses linear interpolation from the origin coordinate to that of the destination. To find an edge's midpoint, use the step 0.5 .
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      step - the step
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the point

    • inclination

      public static float inclination(Edge3 edge)
      Finds the inclination of an edge. Subtracts the destination coordinate from that of the origin, then supplies the difference to arc sine .
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the heading
      See Also:
      • Utils.invHypot(float, float, float)
      • Utils.asin(float)

    • mag

      public static float mag(Edge3 edge)
      Finds the Euclidean distance from the edge's origin coordinate to that of its destination.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the magnitude
      See Also:
      • Vec3.distEuclidean(Vec3, Vec3)

    • magSq

      public static float magSq(Edge3 edge)
      Finds the squared Euclidean distance from the edge's origin coordinate to that of its destination.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      Returns:
      the magnitude
      See Also:
      • Vec3.distSq(Vec3, Vec3)

    • projectVector

      public static Vec3 projectVector(Edge3 edge, Vec3 v, Vec3 target)
      Projects a vector, representing a point, onto an edge. The scalar projection is clamped to the range [0.0, 1.0] , meaning the projection will not exceed the edge's origin and destination.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge
      v - the input vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the projection

    • sharedCoord

      public static int sharedCoord(Edge3 a, Edge3 b)
      Tests to see if two edges share a vertex coordinate:
      • Returns -1 when a's origin is b's destination.
      • Returns -2 when a's destination is b's destination
      • Returns 1 when a's destination is b's origin.
      • Returns 2 when a's origin is b's origin.
      • Returns 0 when none of the above conditions are met.
      If the left and right comparisand are the same, returns 2.
      Parameters:
      a - the left comparisand
      b - the right comparisand
      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:
      • Vert3.approxCoord(Vert3, Vert3)
